00156 cache_entry_t * nfs_FhandleToCache(  u_long                 rq_vers, 
00157                                      fhandle2             * pfh2, 
00158                                      nfs_fh3              * pfh3,
00159                                      nfs_fh4              * pfh4,
00160                                      nfsstat2             * pstatus2,
00161                                      nfsstat3             * pstatus3, 
00162                                      nfsstat4             * pstatus4,
00163                                      fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00164                                      fsal_op_context_t    * pcontext,   
00165                                      cache_inode_client_t * pclient,
00166                                      hash_table_t         * ht, 
00167                                      int                  * prc )
00168 {
00169   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsal_data ;
00170   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00171   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
00172   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
00173   short                     exportid ;
00174 
00175   /* Default behaviour */ 
00176   *prc = NFS_REQ_OK ; 
00177  
00178   switch( rq_vers )
00179     {
00180     case NFS_V4:
00181       if( !nfs4_FhandleToFSAL( pfh4, &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) )
00182         {
00183           *prc      = NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00184           *pstatus4 = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00185           return NULL ;
00186         }
00187       exportid = nfs4_FhandleToExportId( pfh4 ) ;
00188       break ;
00189       
00190     case NFS_V3:
00191       if( !nfs3_FhandleToFSAL( pfh3, &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) )
00192         {
00193           *prc      = NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00194           *pstatus3 = NFS3ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00195           return NULL ;
00196         }
00197       exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( pfh3 ) ;
00198       break ;
00199       
00200     case NFS_V2:
00201       if( !nfs2_FhandleToFSAL( pfh2, &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) )
00202         {
00203           *prc      = NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00204           *pstatus2 = NFSERR_STALE ;
00205           return NULL ;
00206         }
00207       exportid = nfs2_FhandleToExportId( pfh2 ) ;
00208       break ;
00209     }
00210   fsal_data.cookie = DIR_START ;
00211 #ifdef _DEBUG_FILEHANDLE
00212   print_buff( (char *)&fsal_data.handle, sizeof( fsal_data.handle ) ) ;
00213 #endif
00214 
00215   if( ( pentry = cache_inode_get( &fsal_data, 
00216                                   &attr, 
00217                                   ht, 
00218                                   pclient, 
00219                                   pcontext, 
00220                                   &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00221     {
00222       switch( rq_vers )
00223         {
00224         case NFS_V4:
00225           *pstatus4 = NFS4ERR_STALE ;
00226           break ;
00227           
00228         case NFS_V3:
00229           *pstatus3 = NFS3ERR_STALE ;
00230           break ;
00231           
00232         case NFS_V2:
00233           *pstatus2 = NFSERR_STALE ;
00234           break ;
00235         }
00236       *prc = NFS_REQ_OK ;
00237       return NULL ;
00238     }
00239   
00240   if( pattr != NULL )
00241     *pattr = attr ;
00242 
00243   return pentry ;
00244 } /* nfs_FhandleToCache */

00261 int nfs_SetPostOpAttr(fsal_op_context_t  * pcontext,
00262                       exportlist_t       * pexport,
00263                       cache_entry_t      * pentry,
00264                       fsal_attrib_list_t * pfsal_attr,
00265                       post_op_attr       * presult )
00266 {
00267   if( pentry == NULL )
00268     {
00269       presult->attributes_follow = FALSE;
00270       return 0 ;
00271     }
00272   
00273   if( pfsal_attr == NULL )
00274     {
00275       presult->attributes_follow = FALSE;
00276       return 0 ;
00277     }
00278 
00279   if( nfs3_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport, pfsal_attr , &(presult->post_op_attr_u.attributes) ) == 0 )
00280     presult->attributes_follow = FALSE;
00281   else
00282     presult->attributes_follow = TRUE ;
00283   
00284   return 0;
00285 } /* nfs_SetPostOpAttr */
00286 
00287 
00300 void nfs_SetPreOpAttr( fsal_attrib_list_t * pfsal_attr,
00301                        pre_op_attr        * pattr )
00302 {
00303   if( pfsal_attr == NULL)
00304     {
00305       pattr->attributes_follow = FALSE;
00306     } 
00307   else
00308     {
00309       pattr->pre_op_attr_u.attributes.size = pfsal_attr->filesize ;
00310             
00311       pattr->pre_op_attr_u.attributes.mtime.seconds   = pfsal_attr->mtime.seconds ;
00312       pattr->pre_op_attr_u.attributes.mtime.nseconds =  pfsal_attr->mtime.nseconds ;
00313 
00314       pattr->pre_op_attr_u.attributes.ctime.seconds  = pfsal_attr->ctime.seconds ;
00315       pattr->pre_op_attr_u.attributes.ctime.nseconds = pfsal_attr->ctime.nseconds ;
00316 
00317       pattr->attributes_follow = TRUE;
00318     }
00319 } /* nfs_SetPreOpAttr */

00338 void nfs_SetWccData( fsal_op_context_t  * pcontext, 
00339                      exportlist_t       * pexport,
00340                      cache_entry_t      * pentry, 
00341                      fsal_attrib_list_t * pbefore_attr,
00342                      fsal_attrib_list_t * pafter_attr,
00343                      wcc_data           * pwcc_data )
00344 {
00345   /* Build directory pre operation attributes */
00346   nfs_SetPreOpAttr( pbefore_attr, 
00347                     &(pwcc_data->before) );
00348   
00349   /* Build directory post operation attributes */
00350   nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext,
00351                      pexport, 
00352                      pentry, 
00353                      pafter_attr,
00354                      &(pwcc_data->after) );
00355 
00356   return ;
00357 } /* nfs_SetWccData */

00372 int nfs_RetryableError( cache_inode_status_t cache_status )
00373 {
00374   switch( cache_status )
00375    {
00376       case CACHE_INODE_IO_ERROR :
00377       if( nfs_param.core_param.drop_io_errors ) 
00378       {
00379         /* Drop the request */
00380         return TRUE ;
00381       }
00382       else
00383       {
00384         /* Propagate error to the client */
00385         return FALSE ;
00386       } 
00387       break ;
00388 
00389       case CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT     :
00390       if( nfs_param.core_param.drop_inval_errors ) 
00391       {
00392         /* Drop the request */
00393         return TRUE ;
00394       }
00395       else
00396       {
00397         /* Propagate error to the client */
00398         return FALSE ;
00399       } 
00400       break ;
00401        
00402        
00403        case CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS:
00404            /* DisplayLog( "Possible implementation error: CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS managed as an error" ) ; */
00405            return FALSE ;
00406            break ;
00407  
00408        case CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR         :
00409        case CACHE_INODE_POOL_MUTEX_INIT_ERROR:
00410        case CACHE_INODE_GET_NEW_LRU_ENTRY    :
00411        case CACHE_INODE_UNAPPROPRIATED_KEY   :
00412        case CACHE_INODE_INIT_ENTRY_FAILED    :
00413        case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR           :
00414        case CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR            :
00415        case CACHE_INODE_HASH_SET_ERROR       :
00416        case CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY   :
00417        case CACHE_INODE_HASH_TABLE_ERROR     :
00418        case CACHE_INODE_INSERT_ERROR         :
00419            /* Internal error, should be dropped and retryed */
00420            return TRUE ;
00421            break ;
00422  
00423        case CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY       :
00424        case CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE              :
00425        case CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS          :
00426        case CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY         : 
00427        case CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND             :
00428        case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EACCESS          :
00429        case CACHE_INODE_IS_A_DIRECTORY        :
00430        case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EPERM            :
00431        case CACHE_INODE_NO_SPACE_LEFT         :
00432        case CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_ERROR   :
00433        case CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS  :
00434        case CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EMPTY   :
00435        case CACHE_INODE_READ_ONLY_FS          : 
00436        case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE           :
00437        case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERR_SEC          :
00438        case CACHE_INODE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED        :
00439            /* Non retryable error, return error to client */
00440            return FALSE ;       
00441            break ;
00442     
00443        default:
00444            /* Management of this value was forgotten */
00445            DisplayLog( "cache_inode_status=%u not managed properly in nfs_RetryableError, not retryable", cache_status ) ;  
00446            return FALSE ;
00447      }
00448 
00449   /* Should never reach this */
00450   DisplayLog( "cache_inode_status=%u not managed properly in nfs_RetryableError, line %u should never be reached", cache_status, __LINE__ ) ;
00451   return FALSE   ;
00452 }
00453  
00454 void nfs_SetFailedStatus( fsal_op_context_t      * pcontext,
00455                           exportlist_t           * pexport,
00456                           int                      version,
00457                           cache_inode_status_t     status,
00458                           nfsstat2               * pstatus2,
00459                           nfsstat3               * pstatus3,
00460                           cache_entry_t          * pentry0,
00461                           post_op_attr           * ppost_op_attr,
00462                           cache_entry_t          * pentry1,
00463                           fsal_attrib_list_t     * ppre_vattr1,
00464                           wcc_data               * pwcc_data1,
00465                           cache_entry_t          * pentry2,
00466                           fsal_attrib_list_t     * ppre_vattr2,
00467                           wcc_data               * pwcc_data2)
00468 {
00469   switch (version)
00470     {
00471     case NFS_V2:
00472       if( status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) /* Should not use success to address a failed status */
00473         *pstatus2 = nfs2_Errno( status );
00474       break;
00475       
00476     case NFS_V3:
00477       if( status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) /* Should not use success to address a failed status */
00478         *pstatus3 = nfs3_Errno( status );
00479       
00480       if( ppost_op_attr != NULL )
00481         nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext, pexport, pentry0, NULL, ppost_op_attr);
00482       
00483       if( pwcc_data1 != NULL )
00484         nfs_SetWccData( pcontext, pexport, pentry1, ppre_vattr1, NULL, pwcc_data1 );
00485       
00486       if( pwcc_data2 != NULL)
00487         nfs_SetWccData( pcontext, pexport, pentry2, ppre_vattr2, NULL, pwcc_data2 );
00488       break ;
00489       
00490     }
00491 }

00508 int nfs4_FSALattr_To_Fattr( exportlist_t       * pexport,
00509                             fsal_attrib_list_t * pattr, 
00510                             fattr4             * Fattr, 
00511                             compound_data_t    * data, 
00512                             nfs_fh4            * objFH,
00513                             bitmap4            * Bitmap) 
00514 {
00515   fattr4_type               file_type ;
00516   fattr4_link_support       link_support ;
00517   fattr4_symlink_support    symlink_support ;
00518   fattr4_fh_expire_type     expire_type ;
00519   fattr4_named_attr         named_attr ;
00520   fattr4_unique_handles     unique_handles ;
00521   fattr4_archive            archive ;
00522   fattr4_cansettime         cansettime ;
00523   fattr4_case_insensitive   case_insensitive ;
00524   fattr4_case_preserving    case_preserving ;
00525   fattr4_chown_restricted   chown_restricted ;
00526   fattr4_hidden             hidden ;
00527   fattr4_mode               file_mode ;
00528   fattr4_no_trunc           no_trunc ;
00529   fattr4_numlinks           file_numlinks ;
00530   fattr4_rawdev             rawdev ;
00531   fattr4_system             system ;
00532   fattr4_size               file_size ;
00533   fattr4_space_used         file_space_used ;
00534   fattr4_fsid               fsid ;
00535   fattr4_time_access        time_access ;
00536   fattr4_time_modify        time_modify ;
00537   fattr4_time_metadata      time_metadata ;
00538   fattr4_time_delta         time_delta ;
00539   fattr4_change             file_change ;
00540   fattr4_fileid             file_id ;
00541   fattr4_owner              file_owner ;
00542   fattr4_owner_group        file_owner_group ;
00543   fattr4_space_avail        space_avail ;
00544   fattr4_space_free         space_free ;
00545   fattr4_space_total        space_total ;
00546   fattr4_files_avail        files_avail ;
00547   fattr4_files_free         files_free ;
00548   fattr4_files_total        files_total ;
00549   fattr4_lease_time         lease_time ;
00550   fattr4_time_backup        time_backup ;
00551   fattr4_time_create        time_create ;
00552   fattr4_maxfilesize        max_filesize ;
00553   fattr4_supported_attrs    supported_attrs ;
00554   fattr4_fs_locations       fs_locations ;
00555   fattr4_maxread            maxread ;
00556   fattr4_maxwrite           maxwrite ;
00557   fattr4_maxname            maxname ;
00558   fattr4_maxlink            maxlink ;
00559   fattr4_homogeneous        homogeneous ;
00560   fattr4_aclsupport         aclsupport ;
00561   fattr4_acl                acl ;
00562   fattr4_mimetype           mimetype ;
00563   fattr4_mounted_on_fileid  mounted_on_fileid ;
00564   fattr4_rdattr_error       rdattr_error ;
00565   fattr4_quota_avail_hard   quota_avail_hard ;
00566   fattr4_quota_avail_soft   quota_avail_soft ;
00567   fattr4_quota_used         quota_used ;
00568   fattr4_time_modify_set    __attribute__(( __unused__ )) time_modify_set ;
00569   fattr4_time_access_set    __attribute__(( __unused__ )) time_access_set ; 
00570   uint32_t attribute_to_set = 0 ; 
00571 
00572   u_int    fhandle_len = 0 ; 
00573   uint32_t supported_attrs_len ;
00574   uint32_t supported_attrs_val ;
00575   u_int    LastOffset ;
00576   u_int    len = 0 , off = 0 ; /* Use for XDR alignment */
00577   int      op_attr_success = 0 ;
00578   char     __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_FSALattr_To_Fattr" ;
00579 
00580   unsigned int attrvalslist_supported[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ;
00581   uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
00582   uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
00583   uint32_t attrvalslist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
00584   char attrvalsBuffer[ ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN] ;
00585   
00586   uint_t i      = 0 ;
00587   uint_t j      = 0 ;
00588   uint_t k      = 0 ;
00589   uint_t c      = 0 ;
00590 
00591   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00592   
00593   int statfscalled = 0 ;
00594   fsal_staticfsinfo_t  staticinfo ;
00595   fsal_dynamicfsinfo_t dynamicinfo ;
00596   
00597   fsal_handle_t mounted_on_fsal_handle ;
00598   fsal_status_t fsal_status ;
00599 
00600   /* basic init */
00601   memset( attrvalsBuffer, 0, NFS4_ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN ) ;
00602   memset( (uint32_t *)attrmasklist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00603   memset( (uint32_t *)attrvalslist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00604   
00605   /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
00606   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( Bitmap, &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
00607 
00608   /* Once the bitmap has been converted to a list of attribute, manage each attribute */
00609   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = 0 ;
00610   LastOffset  = 0 ; 
00611   j=0 ;
00612 
00613 
00614   for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
00615     {
00616       attribute_to_set = attrmasklist[i] ;
00617 
00618       if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
00619         {
00620           /* Erroneous value... skip */
00621           continue ;
00622         }
00623   
00624 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00625       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00626                        "Flag for Operation (Regular) = %d|%d is ON,  name  = %s  reply_size = %d",
00627                        attrmasklist[i], 
00628                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].val, 
00629                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name, 
00630                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
00631 #endif
00632 
00633       op_attr_success = 0 ;
00634       
00635       /* compute the new size for the fattr4 reply */
00636       /* This space is to be filled below in the big switch/case statement */
00637       switch( attribute_to_set )
00638         {
00639         case FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS:              
00640           /* The supported attributes have field ',supported' set in tab fattr4tab, I will proceed in 2 pass 
00641            * 1st: compute the number of supported attributes
00642            * 2nd: allocate the replyed bitmap and fill it
00643            *
00644            * I do not set a #define to keep the number of supported attributes because I want this parameter
00645            * to be a consequence of fattr4tab and avoid incoherency */
00646           
00647           /* How many supported attributes ? Compute the result in variable named c */
00648           c = 0 ;
00649           for( k = FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS ; k <= FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID ; k++ )
00650             {
00651               if( fattr4tab[k].supported )
00652                 {
00653                   attrvalslist_supported[c++] = k ;
00654                 }
00655             }
00656 
00657 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00658           /* For debugging memory leaks */
00659           BuddySetDebugLabel( "FSALattr_To_Fattr:supported_bitmap" ) ;
00660 #endif
00661           
00662           /* Let set the reply bitmap */
00663           if( ( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc(  2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00664                 return -1 ;
00665           memset( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val, 0,  2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00666 
00667           nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &supported_attrs, &c, attrvalslist_supported ) ;
00668 
00669 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00670          /* For debugging memory leaks */
00671          BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00672 #endif
00673 
00674 
00675 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00676           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Fattr (regular) supported_attrs(len)=%u -> %u|%u", 
00677                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_len, supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[0],
00678                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
00679 #endif
00680 
00681           /* This kind of operation is always a success */
00682           op_attr_success = 1 ; 
00683 
00684           /* we store the index */
00685           supported_attrs_len = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ) ; 
00686           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_len, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ; 
00687           LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;   
00688 
00689           /* And then the data */
00690           for( k = 0 ; k <  supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ; k++ )
00691             {
00692               supported_attrs_val = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[k] );
00693               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_val, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00694               LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;
00695             }
00696 
00697           Mem_Free( (char *)supported_attrs.bitmap4_val ) ;
00698           break ; 
00699               
00700                
00701         case FATTR4_TYPE:
00702           switch( pattr->type )
00703             {
00704             case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
00705             case FSAL_TYPE_XATTR:
00706               file_type = htonl( NF4REG ) ; /* Regular file */
00707               break ;
00708                   
00709             case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
00710               file_type = htonl( NF4DIR ); /* Directory */
00711               break ;
00712 
00713             case FSAL_TYPE_BLK:
00714               file_type = htonl( NF4BLK ); /* Special File - block device */
00715               break ;
00716                   
00717             case FSAL_TYPE_CHR:
00718               file_type = htonl( NF4CHR ) ; /* Special File - character device */
00719               break ;
00720                   
00721             case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
00722               file_type = htonl( NF4LNK ) ; /* Symbolic Link */
00723               break ;
00724 
00725             case FSAL_TYPE_SOCK:
00726               file_type = htonl( NF4SOCK ) ; /* Special File - socket */
00727               break ;
00728                   
00729             case FSAL_TYPE_FIFO :
00730               file_type = htonl( NF4FIFO ) ; /* Special File - fifo */
00731               break ;
00732               
00733             default: /* For wanting of a better solution */
00734               file_type =  0 ;
00735               op_attr_success =0 ; /* This was no success */
00736               break ;
00737             } /* switch( pattr->type ) */
00738 
00739           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_type, sizeof( fattr4_type ) ) ;
00740           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00741           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00742           break ;
00743               
00744         case FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE:
00745           /* For the moment, we handle only the persistent filehandle */
00746           if( nfs_param.nfsv4_param.fh_expire == TRUE )
00747                 expire_type = htonl( FH4_VOLATILE_ANY ) ;
00748           else
00749                 expire_type = htonl( FH4_PERSISTENT ) ; 
00750           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &expire_type, sizeof( expire_type ) ) ;
00751           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00752           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00753           break ;
00754               
00755         case FATTR4_CHANGE:
00756           /* a value that change when the object change. I use the file's mtime */
00757           memset( &file_change, 0, sizeof( changeid4 ) ) ;
00758           file_change = nfs_htonl64( (changeid4)pattr->chgtime.seconds );
00759 
00760           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_change, sizeof(  fattr4_change ) ) ;
00761           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00762           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00763           break ;
00764               
00765         case FATTR4_SIZE:
00766           file_size =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_size)pattr->filesize ) ;
00767           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_size, sizeof(  fattr4_size ) ) ;
00768           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00769           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00770           break ;
00771               
00772         case FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT:
00773           /* HPSS NameSpace support hard link */
00774           link_support = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00775           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &link_support, sizeof( fattr4_link_support )) ; 
00776           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00777           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00778           break ;
00779               
00780         case FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT:
00781           /* HPSS NameSpace support symbolic link */
00782           symlink_support = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00783           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &symlink_support, sizeof( fattr4_symlink_support )) ; 
00784           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00785           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00786           break ;
00787               
00788         case FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR:
00789           /* For this version of the binary, named attributes is not supported */
00790           named_attr = htonl( FALSE );
00791           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &named_attr, sizeof( fattr4_named_attr )) ;
00792           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00793           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00794           break ;
00795               
00796         case FATTR4_FSID:
00797           /* The file system id (taken from the configuration file) */
00798           fsid.major = nfs_htonl64( (uint64_t)pexport->filesystem_id.major );
00799           fsid.minor = nfs_htonl64( (uint64_t)pexport->filesystem_id.minor ) ;
00800           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &fsid, sizeof( fattr4_fsid) ) ;
00801           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00802           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00803           break ;
00804               
00805         case FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES:
00806           /* Filehandles are unique */
00807           unique_handles = htonl( TRUE );
00808           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &unique_handles, sizeof( fattr4_unique_handles) ) ;
00809           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00810           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00811           break ;
00812               
00813         case FATTR4_LEASE_TIME:
00814           if( !statfscalled )
00815             {
00816               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
00817                                                        &staticinfo, 
00818                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
00819                                                        data->pcontext,
00820                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00821                 {
00822                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
00823                   break ;
00824                 }
00825               else
00826                 statfscalled = 1 ;
00827             }
00828           /* lease_time = htonl( (fattr4_lease_time)staticinfo.lease_time.seconds ) ; */
00829           lease_time = htonl( nfs_param.nfsv4_param.lease_lifetime ) ;
00830           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &lease_time, sizeof( fattr4_lease_time ) ) ;
00831           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00832           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00833           break ;
00834               
00835         case FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR:
00836           rdattr_error = htonl( NFS4_OK ) ; /* By default, READDIR call may use a different value */
00837           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &rdattr_error, sizeof( fattr4_rdattr_error ) );
00838           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00839           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00840           break ;
00841               
00842         case FATTR4_ACL:
00843           acl.fattr4_acl_len = htonl( 0 ); /* NOT IMPLEMENTED YET, BUT WILL BE, no ACL for the moment */
00844           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &acl, sizeof( fattr4_acl ) ) ;
00845           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00846           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00847           break ;
00848               
00849         case FATTR4_ACLSUPPORT:
00850           /* aclsupport = htonl( ACL4_SUPPORT_DENY_ACL ); */ /* temporary, wanting for houston to give me information to implemente ACL's support */
00851           aclsupport = htonl( 0 ); 
00852           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &aclsupport, sizeof( fattr4_aclsupport ) ) ;
00853           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00854           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00855           break ;
00856               
00857         case FATTR4_ARCHIVE:
00858           /* Archive flag is not supported */
00859           archive = htonl( FALSE ) ;
00860           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &archive,sizeof( fattr4_archive ) ); 
00861           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00862           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00863           break ;
00864

00866           /* The time can be set on files */

00869           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00870           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00871           break ;
00872               
00873         case FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE:
00874           if( !statfscalled )
00875             {
00876               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
00877                                                        &staticinfo, 
00878                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
00879                                                        data->pcontext,
00880                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00881                 {
00882                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
00883                   break ;
00884                 }
00885               else
00886                 statfscalled = 1 ;
00887             }
00888           case_insensitive = htonl( staticinfo.case_insensitive );
00889           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_insensitive, sizeof( fattr4_case_insensitive ) ) ;
00890           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00891           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00892           break ;
00893               
00894         case FATTR4_CASE_PRESERVING:
00895           /* HPSS is case preserving */
00896            if( !statfscalled )
00897             {
00898               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
00899                                                        &staticinfo, 
00900                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
00901                                                        data->pcontext,
00902                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00903                 {
00904                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
00905                   break ;
00906                 }
00907               else
00908                 statfscalled = 1 ;
00909             }
00910            case_preserving = htonl( staticinfo.case_preserving );
00911            memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_preserving, sizeof( fattr4_case_preserving ) );
00912            LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00913            op_attr_success = 1 ;
00914            break ;
00915            
00916         case FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED :
00917           /* chown is restricted to root */
00918           if( !statfscalled )
00919             {
00920               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
00921                                                        &staticinfo, 
00922                                                        &dynamicinfo,
00923                                                        data->pcontext,
00924                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00925                 {
00926                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
00927                   break ;
00928                 }
00929               else
00930                 statfscalled = 1 ;
00931             }
00932           chown_restricted = htonl( staticinfo.chown_restricted );
00933           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &chown_restricted, sizeof( fattr4_chown_restricted ) ) ; 
00934           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00935           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00936           break ;
00937               
00938         case FATTR4_FILEHANDLE:
00939           /* Return the file handle */
00940           fhandle_len = htonl( objFH->nfs_fh4_len) ;
00941           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  
00942                   &fhandle_len, 
00943                   sizeof( u_int ) ) ; 
00944           LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00945 
00946           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00947                   objFH->nfs_fh4_val, 
00948                   objFH->nfs_fh4_len );
00949           LastOffset +=  objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00950           
00951           /* XDR's special stuff for 32-bit alignment */
00952           len = objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00953           off = 0 ;
00954           while( ( len + off ) %4 != 0 )
00955             {
00956               char c = '\0' ;
00957               
00958               off += 1 ;
00959               memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), (int)c, 1 );
00960               LastOffset += 1 ;
00961             }
00962           
00963           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00964           break ;
00965               
00966         case FATTR4_FILEID:
00967           /* The analog to the inode number. RFC3530 says "a number uniquely identifying the file within the filesystem" 
00968            * I use hpss_GetObjId to extract this information from the Name Server's handle */
00969           file_id = nfs_htonl64( pattr->fileid ) ;
00970           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &file_id, sizeof( fattr4_fileid ) ) ; 
00971           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00972           op_attr_success = 1 ; 
00973           break ;
00974               
00975         case FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL :

00990           files_avail =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)dynamicinfo.avail_files );
00991           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &files_avail, sizeof( fattr4_files_avail ) ) ;
00992           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00993           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00994           break ;
00995               
00996         case FATTR4_FILES_FREE  :
00997           if( !statfscalled )
00998             {
00999               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
01000                                                        &staticinfo, 
01001                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
01002                                                        data->pcontext,
01003                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )

01188               
01189         case  FATTR4_NUMLINKS:

01192           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_numlinks, sizeof( fattr4_numlinks ) ) ;
01193           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01194           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01195           break ;
01196               
01197         case  FATTR4_OWNER:
01198           /* Return the uid as a human readable utf8 string */
01199           if( uid2utf8( pattr->owner, &file_owner ) == 0 )
01200             {
01201               u_int utf8len = 0 ;
01202               u_int deltalen = 0 ;
01203 
01204               /* Take care of 32 bits alignment */
01205               if( file_owner.utf8string_len % 4 == 0 )
01206                  deltalen = 0 ;
01207               else
01208                  deltalen = 4 - file_owner.utf8string_len%4  ;
01209 
01210               utf8len = htonl( file_owner.utf8string_len + deltalen ) ; 
01211               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
01212                       &utf8len, 
01213                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
01214               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
01215                   
01216               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
01217                       file_owner.utf8string_val, 
01218                       file_owner.utf8string_len ) ;
01219               LastOffset += file_owner.utf8string_len ;
01220 
01221               /* Free what was allocated by uid2utf8 */
01222               Mem_Free( (char *)file_owner.utf8string_val ) ;
01223 
01224               /* Pad with zero to keep xdr alignement */
01225               if( deltalen != 0 )
01226                 memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 0, deltalen ) ;
01227               LastOffset += deltalen ;
01228 
01229               op_attr_success = 1 ;
01230                   
01231             }
01232           else
01233             op_attr_success = 0 ;
01234           break ;
01235               
01236         case  FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP :
01237           /* Return the gid as a human-readable utf8 string */
01238           if( gid2utf8( pattr->group, &file_owner_group ) == 0 )
01239             {
01240               u_int utf8len = 0 ;
01241               u_int deltalen = 0 ;
01242 
01243               /* Take care of 32 bits alignment */
01244               if( file_owner_group.utf8string_len % 4 == 0 )
01245                  deltalen = 0 ;
01246               else
01247                  deltalen = 4 - file_owner_group.utf8string_len%4  ;
01248 
01249               utf8len = htonl( file_owner_group.utf8string_len + deltalen ) ;
01250               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
01251                       &utf8len,
01252                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
01253               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
01254 
01255               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
01256                       file_owner_group.utf8string_val, 
01257                       file_owner_group.utf8string_len ) ;
01258               LastOffset += file_owner_group.utf8string_len ;
01259 
01260               /* Free what was used for utf8 conversion */
01261               Mem_Free( (char *)file_owner_group.utf8string_val ) ;
01262 
01263               /* Pad with zero to keep xdr alignement */
01264               if( deltalen != 0 )
01265                 memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 0, deltalen ) ;
01266               LastOffset += deltalen ;
01267 
01268               op_attr_success = 1 ;
01269                   
01270             }
01271           else
01272             op_attr_success = 0 ;
01273           break ;
01274               
01275         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD:
01276           quota_avail_hard =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_hard)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_HARD ) ; 
01277           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_hard, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_hard ) );
01278           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01279           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01280           break ;
01281               
01282         case FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT :
01283           quota_avail_soft =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_soft)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_SOFT ) ; 
01284           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_soft, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_soft ) );
01285           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01286           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01287           break ;
01288               
01289         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_USED:
01290           quota_used =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_used)pattr->filesize ) ;
01291           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_used, sizeof( fattr4_quota_used ) );
01292           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01293           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01294           break ;
01295 
01296         case  FATTR4_RAWDEV:
01297           rawdev.specdata1 = htonl( pattr->rawdev.major ) ;
01298           rawdev.specdata2 = htonl( pattr->rawdev.minor ) ;
01299           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &rawdev, sizeof( fattr4_rawdev ) ) ;
01300           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01301           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01302           break ;
01303           
01304         case FATTR4_SPACE_AVAIL :
01305           if( !statfscalled )
01306             {
01307               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
01308                                                        &staticinfo, 
01309                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
01310                                                        data->pcontext,
01311                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01312                 {
01313                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
01314                   break ;
01315                 }
01316               else
01317                 statfscalled = 1 ;
01318             }
01319           space_avail = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_avail) dynamicinfo.avail_bytes );
01320           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_avail, sizeof( fattr4_space_avail ) ) ;
01321           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01322           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01323           break ;
01324           
01325         case FATTR4_SPACE_FREE :
01326           if( !statfscalled )
01327             {
01328               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
01329                                                        &staticinfo, 
01330                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
01331                                                        data->pcontext,
01332                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01333                 {
01334                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
01335                   break ;
01336                 }
01337               else
01338                 statfscalled = 1 ;
01339             }
01340           space_free = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_free)dynamicinfo.free_bytes );
01341           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_free, sizeof( fattr4_space_free ) ) ;
01342           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01343           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01344           break ;
01345               
01346         case FATTR4_SPACE_TOTAL :
01347           if( !statfscalled )
01348             {
01349               if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_statfs( data->current_entry, 
01350                                                        &staticinfo, 
01351                                                        &dynamicinfo, 
01352                                                        data->pcontext,
01353                                                        &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01354                   {
01355                     op_attr_success = 0 ;
01356                     break ;
01357                   }
01358                     else
01359                     statfscalled = 1 ;
01360             }
01361           space_total = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_total)dynamicinfo.total_bytes );
01362           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_total, sizeof( fattr4_space_total ) ) ;
01363           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01364           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01365           break ;
01366               
01367         case FATTR4_SPACE_USED:
01368           /* the number of bytes on the filesystem used by the object, which is slightly different 
01369            * from the file's size (there can be hole in the file) */
01370           file_space_used = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_used)pattr->spaceused );
01371           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_space_used, sizeof( fattr4_space_used ) ) ;
01372           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01373           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01374           break ;
01375               
01376         case FATTR4_SYSTEM:
01377           /* This is not a windows system File-System with respect to the regarding API */
01378           system = htonl( FALSE );
01379           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &system, sizeof( fattr4_system ) ) ;
01380           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01381           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01382           break ;
01383               
01384         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS:
01385           /* This will contain the object's time os last access, the 'atime' in the Unix semantic */
01386           memset( &(time_access.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01387           time_access.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)pattr->atime.seconds );
01388           time_access.nseconds = htonl( (uint32_t)pattr->atime.nseconds );
01389           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_access, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01390           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01391           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01392           break ;
01393           
01394         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET:
01395 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
01396           op_attr_success = 0 ; /* should never be used here outside FSAL_PROXY */
01397 #else
01398           time_access_set.set_it = htonl( SET_TO_CLIENT_TIME4 ) ;
01399           time_access_set.settime4_u.time.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)pattr->atime.seconds ) ;
01400           time_access_set.settime4_u.time.nseconds = htonl( pattr->atime.nseconds ) ;
01401 
01402           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_access_set, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01403           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01404           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01405 #endif
01406           break ;
01407           
01408         case FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP :
01409           /* No time backup, return unix's beginning of time */
01410           time_backup.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01411           time_backup.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01412           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_backup, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01413           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01414           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01415           break ;
01416           
01417         case FATTR4_TIME_CREATE :
01418           /* No time create, return unix's beginning of time */
01419           time_create.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01420           time_create.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01421           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_create, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01422           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01423           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01424           break ;
01425           
01426         case  FATTR4_TIME_DELTA:
01427           /* According to RFC3530, this is "the smallest usefull server time granularity", I set this to 1s */
01428           time_delta.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 1LL );
01429           time_delta.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01430           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_delta, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01431           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01432           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01433           break ;
01434           
01435         case FATTR4_TIME_METADATA :
01436           /* The time for the last metadata operation, the ctime in the unix's semantic */
01437           memset( &(time_metadata.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01438           time_metadata.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)pattr->ctime.seconds );
01439           time_metadata.nseconds = htonl( pattr->ctime.nseconds );
01440           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_metadata, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01441           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01442           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01443           break ;
01444           
01445         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY :
01446           /* The time for the last modify operation, the mtime in the unix's semantic */
01447           memset( &(time_modify.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01448           time_modify.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)pattr->mtime.seconds );
01449           time_modify.nseconds = htonl( pattr->mtime.nseconds );
01450           
01451           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_modify, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01452           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01453           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01454           break ;
01455           
01456         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET:
01457 #ifndef _USE_PROXY
01458           op_attr_success = 0 ; /* should never be used here outside FSAL_PROXY */
01459 #else
01460           time_modify_set.set_it = htonl( SET_TO_CLIENT_TIME4 ) ;
01461           time_modify_set.settime4_u.time.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)pattr->mtime.seconds ) ;
01462           time_modify_set.settime4_u.time.nseconds = htonl( pattr->mtime.nseconds ) ;
01463 
01464           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_modify_set, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01465           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01466           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01467 #endif
01468           break ;
01469           
01470         case FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID :
01471           /* The analog to the inode number. RFC3530 says "a number uniquely identifying the file within the filesystem" 
01472            * I use hpss_GetObjId to extract this information from the Name Server's handle */
01473           /* Here, the filehandle used is the "mouted on FH" kept in compound_data_t */
01474           if( !nfs4_FhandleToFSAL( &data->mounted_on_FH, &mounted_on_fsal_handle, data->pcontext ) )
01475             {
01476               if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = FSAL_DigestHandle( data->pcontext->export_context,
01477                                                                   FSAL_DIGEST_FILEID4 , 
01478                                                                   &mounted_on_fsal_handle,
01479                                                                   (caddr_t)&mounted_on_fileid ) ) )  
01480                 {
01481                   op_attr_success = 0 ;
01482                 }
01483               else
01484                 { 
01485                   mounted_on_fileid = nfs_htonl64( mounted_on_fileid ) ;
01486                   memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &mounted_on_fileid, sizeof( fattr4_mounted_on_fileid ) ) ; 
01487                   LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01488                   op_attr_success = 1 ; 
01489                 }
01490             }
01491           else
01492             op_attr_success = 0 ;
01493           break ;
01494           
01495         default:
01496 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
01497           printf( " unsupported value for attributes bitmap = %u\n", attribute_to_set ) ;
01498 #endif
01499          op_attr_success = 0 ; 
01500           break ;
01501         } /* switch( attribute_to_set ) */
01502       
01503       /* Increase the Offset for the next operation if this was a success*/
01504       if( op_attr_success )
01505         {
01506           /* Set the returned bitmask */
01507           attrvalslist[j] = attribute_to_set ;
01508           j += 1 ;
01509 
01510           /* Be carefull not to get out of attrvalsBuffer */
01511           if( LastOffset > ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN )
01512             return -1 ;
01513         }
01514       
01515     } /* for i */
01516  
01517 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01518   /* For debugging memory leaks */
01519   BuddySetDebugLabel( "FSALattr_To_Fattr:bitmap" ) ;
01520 #endif
01521  
01522   /* Set the bitmap for result */
01523   if( ( Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc( 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ) == NULL )
01524         return -1 ;
01525   memset( (char *)Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val, 0, 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
01526 
01527 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01528   /* For debugging memory leaks */
01529   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
01530 #endif
01531  
01532   nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &(Fattr->attrmask), &j, attrvalslist ) ;
01533 
01534   /* Set the attrlist4 */
01535   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = LastOffset ;
01536   if( LastOffset != 0 ) /* No need to allocate an empty buffer */
01537     {
01538 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01539      /* For debugging memory leaks */
01540      BuddySetDebugLabel( "FSALattr_To_Fattr:attrvals" ) ;
01541 #endif
01542  
01543      if( ( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val = Mem_Alloc( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ) == NULL )
01544          return -1 ;
01545      memset( (char *)Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, 0, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01546      memcpy( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, attrvalsBuffer, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len );
01547 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01548      /* For debugging memory leaks */
01549      BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
01550 #endif
01551  
01552     }
01553   /* LastOffset contains the length of the attrvalsBuffer usefull data */
01554 
01555 
01556   return 0;
01557 } /* nfs4_FSALattr_To_Fattr */
01558 
01559 
01560 
01573 int nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr( fsal_attrib_list_t * pFSAL_attr,  /* Out: file attributes */
01574                             sattr3             * psattr )     /* In: file attributes  */
01575 {
01576   struct timeval t ;
01577   
01578   if( pFSAL_attr == NULL || psattr == NULL ) 
01579     return 0 ;
01580 
01581   pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes = 0 ;
01582 
01583   if( psattr->mode.set_it == TRUE )
01584     {
01585 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01586       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: mode = %o\n", psattr->mode.set_mode3_u.mode ) ;
01587 #endif
01588       pFSAL_attr->mode = unix2fsal_mode( psattr->mode.set_mode3_u.mode ) ;
01589       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_MODE ;
01590     }
01591   
01592   if( psattr->uid.set_it == TRUE )
01593     {
01594 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01595       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: uid = %d\n", psattr->uid.set_uid3_u.uid ) ;
01596 #endif
01597       pFSAL_attr->owner = psattr->uid.set_uid3_u.uid ;
01598       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_OWNER ;
01599     }
01600   
01601   if( psattr->gid.set_it == TRUE )
01602     {
01603 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01604       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: gid = %d\n", psattr->gid.set_gid3_u.gid ) ;
01605 #endif
01606       pFSAL_attr->group = psattr->gid.set_gid3_u.gid ;
01607       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ;
01608     }
01609 
01610   if( psattr->size.set_it == TRUE )
01611     {
01612 #ifdef  _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01613       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: size = %lld\n", psattr->size.set_size3_u.size ) ;
01614 #endif
01615       pFSAL_attr->filesize  = (fsal_size_t)psattr->size.set_size3_u.size ;
01616       pFSAL_attr->spaceused = (fsal_size_t)psattr->size.set_size3_u.size ; 
01617       /* Both FSAL_ATTR_SIZE and FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED are to be managed */
01618       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SIZE  ;
01619       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
01620     }
01621   
01622   if( psattr->atime.set_it != DONT_CHANGE )
01623     {
01624 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01625       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: set=%d atime = %d,%d\n",  
01626               psattr->atime.set_it, psattr->atime.set_atime_u.atime.seconds, psattr->atime.set_atime_u.atime.nseconds ) ;
01627 #endif
01628       if( psattr->atime.set_it == SET_TO_CLIENT_TIME )
01629         {
01630           pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds  = psattr->atime.set_atime_u.atime.seconds ;
01631           pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = psattr->atime.set_atime_u.atime.nseconds ;
01632         }
01633       else
01634         {
01635           /* Use the server's current time */
01636           gettimeofday( &t, NULL ) ;
01637           
01638           pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds  = t.tv_sec  ;
01639           pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds  = t.tv_usec * 1000 ;
01640         }
01641       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ;
01642     } 
01643   
01644   if( psattr->mtime.set_it != DONT_CHANGE )
01645     {
01646 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01647       printf( "nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr: set=%d mtime = %d,%d\n",  
01648               psattr->atime.set_it, psattr->mtime.set_mtime_u.mtime.seconds, psattr->mtime.set_mtime_u.mtime.nseconds ) ;
01649 #endif
01650       if( psattr->mtime.set_it  == SET_TO_CLIENT_TIME ) 
01651         {
01652           pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds  = psattr->mtime.set_mtime_u.mtime.seconds ;
01653           pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = psattr->mtime.set_mtime_u.mtime.nseconds ;
01654         }
01655       else
01656         {
01657           /* Use the server's current time */
01658           gettimeofday( &t, NULL ) ;
01659           pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds  = t.tv_sec ;
01660           pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = t.tv_usec * 1000 ;
01661         }
01662       pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ;
01663     }
01664    
01665   return 1 ;
01666 } /* nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr */ 
01667 
01681 int nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr( exportlist_t       * pexport,     /* In: the related export entry */
01682                             fsal_attrib_list_t * pFSAL_attr,  /* In: file attributes  */
01683                             fattr2             * pFattr )     /* Out: file attributes */
01684 {      
01685   /* Badly formed arguments */
01686   if( pFSAL_attr == NULL || pFattr == NULL )
01687     return 0 ;
01688   
01689   /* @todo BUGAZOMEU: sanity check on attribute mask (does the FSAL support the attributes required to support NFSv2 ? */
01690 
01691   /* initialize mode */
01692   pFattr->mode = 0;
01693 
01694   switch( pFSAL_attr->type )
01695     {
01696     case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
01697       pFattr->type = NFREG ;
01698       pFattr->mode = NFS2_MODE_NFREG;
01699       break ;
01700       
01701     case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
01702       pFattr->type = NFDIR ;
01703       pFattr->mode = NFS2_MODE_NFDIR;
01704       break ;
01705       
01706     case FSAL_TYPE_BLK:
01707       pFattr->type = NFBLK ;
01708       pFattr->mode = NFS2_MODE_NFBLK;
01709       break ;
01710       
01711     case FSAL_TYPE_CHR:
01712       pFattr->type = NFCHR ;
01713       pFattr->mode = NFS2_MODE_NFCHR;
01714       break ;
01715       
01716     case FSAL_TYPE_FIFO:
01717       pFattr->type = NFFIFO ;
01719       break ;
01720       
01721     case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
01722       pFattr->type = NFLNK ;
01723       pFattr->mode = NFS2_MODE_NFLNK;
01724       break ;
01725       
01726     case FSAL_TYPE_SOCK:
01727       pFattr->type = NFSOCK ;
01730     default:
01731       pFattr->type = NFBAD ;
01732     }
01733   
01734   pFattr->mode  |= fsal2unix_mode( pFSAL_attr->mode );
01735   pFattr->nlink = pFSAL_attr->numlinks ;
01736   pFattr->uid   = pFSAL_attr->owner ;
01737   pFattr->gid   = pFSAL_attr->group ;
01738   
01739   /* in NFSv2, it only keeps fsid.major, casted into an into an int32 */
01740   pFattr->fsid = (u_int)(pexport->filesystem_id.major & 0xFFFFFFFFLL) ;
01741   
01742 #ifdef  _DEBUG_NFSPROTO  
01743   printf( "nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr: fsid.major = %#llX (%llu), fsid.minor = %#llX (%llu), nfs2_fsid = %#X (%u)\n",
01744           pexport->filesystem_id.major, pexport->filesystem_id.major,
01745           pexport->filesystem_id.minor, pexport->filesystem_id.minor,
01746           pFattr->fsid, pFattr->fsid );
01747 #endif  
01748   
01749   if( pFSAL_attr->filesize > NFS2_MAX_FILESIZE )
01750     pFattr->size = NFS2_MAX_FILESIZE ;
01751   else
01752     pFattr->size = pFSAL_attr->filesize ;
01753   
01754   pFattr->blocksize      = DEV_BSIZE;
01755   
01756   pFattr->blocks         = pFattr->size >> 9 ; /* dividing by 512 */
01757   if ( pFattr->size % DEV_BSIZE != 0 ) pFattr->blocks += 1;
01758   
01759   if ( pFSAL_attr->type == FSAL_TYPE_CHR
01760       || pFSAL_attr->type == FSAL_TYPE_BLK )
01761     pFattr->rdev           = pFSAL_attr->rawdev.major ;
01762   else
01763     pFattr->rdev = 0;  
01764   
01765   pFattr->atime.seconds  = pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds;
01766   pFattr->atime.useconds = pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds/1000;
01767   pFattr->mtime.seconds  = pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds ;
01768   pFattr->mtime.useconds = pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds/1000 ;
01769   pFattr->ctime.seconds  = pFSAL_attr->ctime.seconds ;
01770   pFattr->ctime.useconds = pFSAL_attr->ctime.nseconds/1000 ;
01771   pFattr->fileid         = pFSAL_attr->fileid ;
01772                                       
01773   return 1 ;
01774 } /*  nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr */
01775 
01788 int nfs4_SetCompoundExport( compound_data_t * data )
01789 {
01790   short            exportid ;
01791 
01792   /* This routine is not related to pseudo fs file handle, do not handle them */
01793   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
01794     return NFS4_OK ;
01795   
01796   /* Get the export id */
01797   if( ( exportid = nfs4_FhandleToExportId( &(data->currentFH) ) ) == 0 )
01798     return NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01799 
01800   if( ( data->pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( data->pfullexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
01801     return NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01802 
01803   if( nfs4_MakeCred( data ) != NFS4_OK )
01804     return NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
01805 
01806   return NFS4_OK ;
01807 } /* nfs4_SetCompoundExport */
01808 
01809 
01810 
01823 int nfs4_FhandleToExId( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, unsigned short * ExIdp )
01824 {
01825   file_handle_v4_t * pfhandle4;
01826 
01827   /* Map the filehandle to the correct structure */
01828   pfhandle4 = (file_handle_v4_t *)(fh4p->nfs_fh4_val) ;
01829   
01830   /* The function should not be used on a pseudo fhandle */
01831   if( pfhandle4->pseudofs_flag == TRUE)
01832     return FALSE ;
01833 
01834   *ExIdp = pfhandle4->exportid ;
01835   return TRUE ;
01836 } /* nfs4_FhandleToExId */

01839 
01840 /**** Glue related functions ****/
01841 
01855 void nfs4_stringid_split( char * buff, char * uidname, char * domainname )
01856 {
01857   char *c = NULL ;
01858   unsigned int i = 0 ;
01859 
01860   for( c = buff, i=0  ; *c != '\0' ; c++, i++ )
01861     if( *c == '@' )
01862       break ;
01863   
01864   strcpy( uidname, buff ) ;
01865   uidname[i]='\0' ;
01866   strcpy( domainname, c ) ;
01867 
01868 #ifdef _NFSV4_DEBUG
01869   printf( "buff = #%s#    uid = #%s#   domain = #%s#\n", buff, uidname, domainname ) ;
01870 #endif
01871 } /* nfs4_stringid_split */
01872 
01873 
01886 int utf82str( char * str, utf8string * utf8str )
01887 {
01888   if( utf8str == NULL || utf8str->utf8string_len == 0 )
01889     return -1 ;
01890   
01891   /* BUGAZOMEU: TO BE DONE: use STUFF ALLOCATOR here */
01892   if( str == NULL )
01893     {
01894 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01895        /* For debugging memory leaks */
01896       BuddySetDebugLabel( "utf82str" ) ;
01897 #endif
01898  
01899       if( ( str = (char *)Mem_Alloc( utf8str->utf8string_len + 1 ) ) == NULL )
01900         return NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01901 
01902 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
01903       /* For debugging memory leaks */
01904       BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
01905 #endif
01906  
01907     }
01908   
01909   strncpy( str, utf8str->utf8string_val, utf8str->utf8string_len );
01910   str[utf8str->utf8string_len ] = '\0' ;
01911   
01912   return 0;
01913 } /* uft82str */
01914 
01915 
01928 int str2utf8( char * str, utf8string * utf8str )
01929 {
01930   uint_t  len ;
01931   char buff[MAXNAMLEN] ;
01932   
01933   /* The uft8 will probably be sent over XDR, for this reason, its size MUST be a multiple of 32 bits = 4 bytes */
01934   strcpy( buff, str ) ;
01935   len = strlen( buff ) ;
01936 
01937   /* BUGAZOMEU: TO BE DONE: use STUFF ALLOCATOR here */
01938   if( utf8str->utf8string_val == NULL ) 
01939     return -1 ;
01940   
01941  
01942   utf8str->utf8string_len = len  ; 
01943   memcpy( utf8str->utf8string_val, buff, utf8str->utf8string_len ) ; 
01944   return 0 ;
01945 } /* str2utf8 */
