01947 
01948 
01949 
01950 
01963 seqid4  nfs4_NextSeqId( seqid4 seqid )
01964 {
01965   return ( ( seqid +1 ) % 0xFFFFFFFF ) ;
01966 } /* nfs4_NextSeqId */
01967 
01982 /*
01983  * bitmap is usually 2 x uint32_t which makes a uint64_t 
01984  *
01985  * Structure of the bitmap is as follow
01986  *
01987  *                  0         1
01988  *    +-------+---------+----------+-
01989  *    | count | 31 .. 0 | 63 .. 32 | 
01990  *    +-------+---------+----------+-
01991  *
01992  * One bit is set for every possible attributes. The bits are packed together in a uint32_T (XDR alignment reason probably)
01993  * As said in the RFC3530, the n-th bit is with the uint32_t #(n/32), and its position with the uint32_t is n % 32
01994  * Example
01995  *     1st bit = FATTR4_TYPE            = 1
01996  *     2nd bit = FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT    = 5
01997  *     3rd bit = FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT = 6
01998  *
01999  *     Juste one uint32_t is necessay: 2**1 + 2**5 + 2**6 = 2 + 32 + 64 = 98
02000  *   +---+----+
02001  *   | 1 | 98 |
02002  *   +---+----+
02003  *
02004  * Other Example
02005  *
02006  *     1st bit = FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT    = 5
02007  *     2nd bit = FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT = 6
02008  *     3rd bit = FATTR4_MODE            = 33
02009  *     4th bit = FATTR4_OWNER           = 36
02010  *
02011  *     Two uint32_t will be necessary there:
02012  *            #1 = 2**5 + 2**6 = 32 + 64 = 96
02013  #            #2 = 2**(33-32) + 2**(36-32) = 2**1 + 2**4 = 2 + 16 = 18 
02014  *   +---+----+----+
02015  *   | 2 | 98 | 18 |
02016  *   +---+----+----+
02017  *
02018  */
02019 
02020 void nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( bitmap4 * b, uint_t * plen, uint32_t * pval )
02021 {
02022   uint_t i      = 0 ;
02023   uint_t val    = 0 ;
02024   uint_t index  = 0 ;
02025   uint_t offset = 0 ;
02026 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02027   if( b->bitmap4_len > 0 )
02028         printf( "Bitmap: Len = %u Val = %u|%u\n",  b->bitmap4_len, b->bitmap4_val[0], b->bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
02029   else
02030         printf( "Bitmap: Len = %u ... \n", b->bitmap4_len ) ;
02031 #endif
02032 
02033   for( offset = 0 ; offset < b->bitmap4_len ; offset ++ )
02034     {
02035       for( i = 0 ; i < 32 ; i++ )
02036         {
02037           val = 1 << i ; /* Compute 2**i */
02038           if( b->bitmap4_val[offset] & val )
02039             pval[index++] = i + 32 * offset ;
02040         }
02041     }
02042   *plen = index ;
02043 } /* nfs4_bitmap4_to_list */
02044 
02059 /* bitmap is usually 2 x uint32_t which makes a uint64_t 
02060  * bitmap4_len is the number of uint32_t required to keep the bitmap value 
02061  *
02062  * Structure of the bitmap is as follow
02063  *
02064  *                  0         1
02065  *    +-------+---------+----------+-
02066  *    | count | 31 .. 0 | 63 .. 32 | 
02067  *    +-------+---------+----------+-
02068  *
02069  * One bit is set for every possible attributes. The bits are packed together in a uint32_T (XDR alignment reason probably)
02070  * As said in the RFC3530, the n-th bit is with the uint32_t #(n/32), and its position with the uint32_t is n % 32
02071  * Example
02072  *     1st bit = FATTR4_TYPE            = 1
02073  *     2nd bit = FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT    = 5
02074  *     3rd bit = FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT = 6
02075  *
02076  *     Juste one uint32_t is necessay: 2**1 + 2**5 + 2**6 = 2 + 32 + 64 = 98
02077  *   +---+----+
02078  *   | 1 | 98 |
02079  *   +---+----+
02080  *
02081  * Other Example
02082  *
02083  *     1st bit = FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT    = 5
02084  *     2nd bit = FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT = 6
02085  *     3rd bit = FATTR4_MODE            = 33
02086  *     4th bit = FATTR4_OWNER           = 36
02087  *
02088  *     Two uint32_t will be necessary there:
02089  *            #1 = 2**5 + 2**6 = 32 + 64 = 96
02090  #            #2 = 2**(33-32) + 2**(36-32) = 2**1 + 2**4 = 2 + 16 = 18 
02091  *   +---+----+----+
02092  *   | 2 | 98 | 18 |
02093  *   +---+----+----+
02094  *
02095  */
02096 
02097 /* This function converts a list of attributes to a bitmap4 structure */
02098 void nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( bitmap4 * b, uint_t * plen, uint32_t * pval )
02099 {
02100   uint_t  i ;
02101   uint_t  intpos = 0 ;
02102   uint_t  bitpos = 0 ;
02103   uint_t  val    = 0 ;
02104   /* Both uint32 int the bitmap MUST be allocated */
02105   b->bitmap4_val[0] = 0 ;
02106   b->bitmap4_val[1] = 0 ;
02107   
02108   b->bitmap4_len = 1 ;
02109   for( i = 0 ; i < *plen ; i++ )
02110     {
02111       intpos = pval[i] / 32 ;
02112       bitpos = pval[i] % 32 ;
02113       val = 1 << bitpos ;
02114       b->bitmap4_val[intpos] |= val ;
02115       
02116       if( intpos  != 0 )
02117         b->bitmap4_len = 2 ;
02118     } 
02119 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02120   printf( "Bitmap: Len = %u   Val = %u|%u\n", b->bitmap4_len, 
02121                                               b->bitmap4_len >= 1 ? b->bitmap4_val[0] : 0, 
02122                                               b->bitmap4_len >= 2 ? b->bitmap4_val[1] : 0) ;
02123 #endif
02124 } /* nfs4_list_to_bitmap4 */
02125 
02126 /* 
02127  * Conversion of attributes 
02128 */
02129 
02143 int nfs3_FSALattr_To_Fattr( exportlist_t       * pexport,    /* In: the related export entry */
02144                             fsal_attrib_list_t * FSAL_attr,  /* In: file attributes */
02145                             fattr3             * Fattr)      /* Out: file attributes */
02146 {
02147   if( FSAL_attr == NULL || Fattr == NULL ) 
02148     return 0 ;
02149 
02150   switch( FSAL_attr->type )
02151     {
02152     case FSAL_TYPE_FIFO:
02153       Fattr->type = NF3FIFO;
02154       break ;
02155       
02156     case FSAL_TYPE_CHR:
02157       Fattr->type = NF3CHR ;
02158       break ;
02159       
02160     case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
02161       Fattr->type = NF3DIR ;
02162       break ;
02163       
02164     case FSAL_TYPE_BLK:
02165       Fattr->type = NF3BLK ;
02166       break ;
02167       
02168     case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
02169     case FSAL_TYPE_XATTR:
02170       Fattr->type = NF3REG ;
02171       break ;
02172       
02173     case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
02174       Fattr->type = NF3LNK ;
02175       break ;
02176       
02177     case FSAL_TYPE_SOCK:
02178       Fattr->type = NF3SOCK ;
02179       break ;
02180 
02181     default: /* Should not occur */
02182       Fattr->type = 0 ;
02183       return 0 ;
02184     }
02185   
02186   
02187     Fattr->mode           = fsal2unix_mode( FSAL_attr->mode ) ;
02188     Fattr->nlink          = FSAL_attr->numlinks ;
02189     Fattr->uid            = FSAL_attr->owner ;
02190     Fattr->gid            = FSAL_attr->group ;
02191     Fattr->size           = FSAL_attr->filesize;
02192     Fattr->used           = FSAL_attr->spaceused ;
02193     
02194     if ( FSAL_attr->type == FSAL_TYPE_CHR
02195         || FSAL_attr->type == FSAL_TYPE_BLK )
02196     {
02197       Fattr->rdev.specdata1 = FSAL_attr->rawdev.major ;
02198       Fattr->rdev.specdata2 = FSAL_attr->rawdev.minor ;
02199     }
02200     else
02201     {
02202       Fattr->rdev.specdata1 = 0 ;
02203       Fattr->rdev.specdata2 = 0 ;
02204     }    
02205         
02206     /* in NFSv3, we only keeps fsid.major, casted into an nfs_uint64 */
02207     Fattr->fsid = (nfs3_uint64)pexport->filesystem_id.major;
02208 
02209 #ifdef  _DEBUG_NFSPROTO        
02210     printf( "nfs3_FSALattr_To_Fattr: fsid.major = %#llX (%llu), fsid.minor = %#llX (%llu), nfs3_fsid = %#llX (%llu)\n",
02211             pexport->filesystem_id.major, pexport->filesystem_id.major,
02212             pexport->filesystem_id.minor, pexport->filesystem_id.minor,
02213             Fattr->fsid, Fattr->fsid );
02214 #endif
02215      
02216     
02217     Fattr->fileid         = FSAL_attr->fileid ;
02218     Fattr->atime.seconds  = FSAL_attr->atime.seconds ;
02219     Fattr->atime.nseconds = FSAL_attr->atime.nseconds ;
02220     Fattr->mtime.seconds  = FSAL_attr->mtime.seconds ;
02221     Fattr->mtime.nseconds = FSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds ;
02222     Fattr->ctime.seconds  = FSAL_attr->ctime.seconds ;
02223     Fattr->ctime.nseconds = FSAL_attr->ctime.nseconds ;
02224 
02225   return 1 ;
02226 } /* nfs3_FSALattr_To_Fattr */
02227 
02240 int nfs2_Sattr_To_FSALattr( fsal_attrib_list_t * pFSAL_attr,  /* Out: file attributes */
02241                             sattr2             * Fattr)      /* In: file attributes */
02242 {
02243   struct timeval t ;
02244   
02245   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes );
02246   
02247   if ( Fattr->mode != (unsigned int)-1 )
02248   {
02249     pFSAL_attr->mode = unix2fsal_mode( Fattr->mode );
02250     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_MODE );
02251   }
02252   
02253   if ( Fattr->uid != (unsigned int)-1 )
02254   {
02255     pFSAL_attr->owner = Fattr->uid ;
02256     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_OWNER );
02257   }
02258   
02259   if ( Fattr->gid != (unsigned int)-1 )
02260   {
02261     pFSAL_attr->group = Fattr->gid ;
02262     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_GROUP );
02263   }
02264   
02265   if ( Fattr->size != (unsigned int)-1 )
02266   {
02267     /* Both FSAL_ATTR_SIZE and FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED are to be managed */    
02268     pFSAL_attr->filesize = (fsal_size_t) Fattr->size;
02269     pFSAL_attr->spaceused = (fsal_size_t) Fattr->size;    
02270     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_SIZE );
02271     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED );    
02272   }
02273   
02274   
02275   /* if mtime.useconds == 1 millions,
02276    * this means we must set atime and mtime
02277    * to server time (NFS Illustrated p. 98)
02278    */  
02279   if ( Fattr->mtime.useconds == 1000000 )
02280   {
02281     gettimeofday( &t, NULL ) ;
02282     
02283     pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds  = pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds  = t.tv_sec ;
02284     pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = t.tv_usec * 1000 ;
02285     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_ATIME );
02286     FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_MTIME );    
02287   }
02288   else
02289   {
02290      /* set atime to client */
02291     
02292     if ( Fattr->atime.seconds != (unsigned int)-1 )
02293     {
02294       pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds =  Fattr->atime.seconds;
02295       
02296       if (  Fattr->atime.seconds != (unsigned int)-1 )
02297         pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = Fattr->atime.useconds * 1000;
02298       else
02299         pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = 0; /* ignored */
02300 
02301       FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_ATIME );
02302     }
02303     
02304      /* set mtime to client */
02305     
02306     if ( Fattr->mtime.seconds != (unsigned int)-1 )
02307     {
02308       pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds =  Fattr->mtime.seconds;
02309       
02310       if (  Fattr->mtime.seconds != (unsigned int)-1 )
02311         pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = Fattr->mtime.useconds * 1000;
02312       else
02313         pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = 0; /* ignored */
02314 
02315       
02316       FSAL_SET_MASK( pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes , FSAL_ATTR_MTIME );    
02317     }
02318   }
02319   
02320   return 1 ;
02321 } /* nfs2_Sattr_To_FSALattr */
02322 
02336 int nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access( fattr4 * Fattr,
02337                              int      access )
02338 {
02339    unsigned int i = 0 ;
02340 
02341    uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02342    uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
02343 
02344    /* Parameter sanity check */
02345    if( Fattr == NULL ) 
02346         return 0 ;
02347 
02348    if( access != FATTR4_ATTR_READ &&  access != FATTR4_ATTR_WRITE ) 
02349         return 0 ;
02350 
02351     /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02352     nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( &(Fattr->attrmask), &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
02353 
02354 
02355     for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
02356       {
02357         if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
02358           {
02359              /* Erroneous value... skip */
02360              continue ;
02361           }
02362 
02363         if( ( (int)fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].access & access ) != access )
02364           return 0 ;
02365       }   
02366    
02367     return 1 ;
02368 } /* nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access */
02369 
02383 int nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access_Bitmap( bitmap4 * pbitmap,
02384                                     int       access )
02385 {
02386    unsigned int i = 0 ;
02387 
02388    uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02389    uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
02390 
02391    /* Parameter sanity check */
02392    if( pbitmap == NULL )
02393         return 0 ;
02394 
02395    if( access != FATTR4_ATTR_READ &&  access != FATTR4_ATTR_WRITE )
02396         return 0 ;
02397 
02398     /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02399     nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( pbitmap, &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
02400 
02401 
02402     for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
02403       {
02404         if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
02405           {
02406              /* Erroneous value... skip */
02407              continue ;
02408           }
02409 
02410         if( ( (int)fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].access & access ) != access )
02411           return 0 ;
02412       }
02413 
02414     return 1 ;
02415 } /* nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access */
02416 
02429 int nfs4_Fattr_Supported( fattr4 * Fattr )
02430 {
02431    unsigned int i = 0 ;
02432 
02433    uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02434    uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
02435 
02436    /* Parameter sanity check */
02437    if( Fattr == NULL )
02438         return 0 ;
02439 
02440 
02441     /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02442     nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( &(Fattr->attrmask), &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
02443 
02444     for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
02445       {
02446 
02447         if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
02448           {
02449              /* Erroneous value... skip */
02450              continue ;
02451           }
02452 
02453 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02454         printf( "nfs4_Fattr_Supported  ==============> %s supported flag=%u\n", 
02455                 fattr4tab[ attrmasklist[i]  ].name, fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].supported  ) ;
02456 #endif
02457         if( !fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].supported ) 
02458           return 0 ;
02459       }
02460 
02461     return 1 ;
02462 } /* nfs4_Fattr_Supported */
02463 
02476 int nfs4_Fattr_Supported_Bitmap( bitmap4 * pbitmap )
02477 {
02478    unsigned int i = 0 ;
02479 
02480    uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02481    uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
02482 
02483    /* Parameter sanity check */
02484    if( pbitmap == NULL )
02485         return 0 ;
02486 
02487 
02488     /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02489     nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( pbitmap, &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
02490 
02491     for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
02492       {
02493 
02494         if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
02495           {
02496              /* Erroneous value... skip */
02497              continue ;
02498           }
02499 
02500 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02501         printf( "nfs4_Fattr_Supported  ==============> %s supported flag=%u\n",
02502                 fattr4tab[ attrmasklist[i]  ].name, fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].supported  ) ;
02503 #endif
02504         if( !fattr4tab[attrmasklist[i]].supported )
02505           return 0 ;
02506       }
02507 
02508     return 1 ;
02509 } /* nfs4_Fattr_Supported */
02510 
02523 int nfs4_Fattr_cmp( fattr4 * Fattr1, fattr4 * Fattr2 ) 
02524 {
02525   uint32_t     attrmasklist1[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02526   uint32_t     attrmasklen1 = 0 ;
02527   u_int        LastOffset ;
02528   uint32_t     attrmasklist2[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02529   uint32_t     attrmasklen2 = 0 ;
02530   uint32_t     i ; 
02531   uint32_t     k ;
02532   unsigned int cmp = 0 ;
02533   u_int        len = 0 ;
02534   uint32_t     attribute_to_set = 0 ; 
02535  
02536   if( Fattr1 == NULL ) 
02537         return FALSE ;
02538 
02539   if( Fattr2 == NULL ) 
02540         return FALSE ;
02541 
02542   if( Fattr1->attrmask.bitmap4_len != Fattr2->attrmask.bitmap4_len ) /* different mask */
02543         return FALSE ;
02544 
02545  /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02546   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( &(Fattr1->attrmask), &attrmasklen1, attrmasklist1 ) ;
02547   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( &(Fattr2->attrmask), &attrmasklen2, attrmasklist2 ) ;
02548 
02549  /* Should not occur, bu this is a sanity check */
02550  if( attrmasklen1 != attrmasklen2 ) 
02551         return FALSE ;
02552 
02553  for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen1 ; i++ )
02554    {
02555      if(  attrmasklist1[i] !=  attrmasklist2[i] )
02556         return 0 ;
02557 
02558      if( attrmasklist1[i] == FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR )
02559         return -1 ;
02560 
02561 
02562      if( attrmasklist2[i] == FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR ) 
02563         return -1 ;
02564    }
02565 
02566  cmp = 0 ; 
02567  LastOffset = 0 ;
02568  len = 0 ;
02569 
02570 
02571  for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen1 ; i ++ ) 
02572    {
02573      attribute_to_set = attrmasklist1[i] ;
02574 
02575 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02576      printf( "nfs4_Fattr_cmp ==============> %s\n", fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name  ) ;
02577 #endif
02578 
02579      switch(  attribute_to_set )
02580        {
02581         case FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS:
02582                 memcpy( &len, (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
02583                 cmp += memcmp( (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02584                                (char *)(Fattr2->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02585                                sizeof( u_int ) )  ;
02586 
02587                 len = htonl( len ) ;
02588                 LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
02589 
02590                 for( k = 0 ; k < len ; k++ )
02591                    {
02592                         cmp += memcmp( (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02593                                (char *)(Fattr2->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02594                                sizeof( uint32_t ) )  ;
02595                         LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;
02596                    }
02597                 
02598                 break ;
02599         
02600         case FATTR4_FILEHANDLE:
02601         case FATTR4_OWNER:
02602         case FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP:
02603                  memcpy( &len, (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
02604                 len =  ntohl( len ) ; /* xdr marshalling on fattr4 */
02605                 cmp += memcmp( (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02606                                (char *)(Fattr2->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02607                                sizeof( u_int ) )  ;
02608                 LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
02609                 cmp += memcmp( (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02610                                (char *)(Fattr2->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02611                                len ) ;
02612                 break ;
02613 
02614         case FATTR4_TYPE:
02615         case FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE:
02616         case FATTR4_CHANGE:
02617         case FATTR4_SIZE:
02618         case FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT:
02619         case FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT:
02620         case FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR:
02621         case FATTR4_FSID:
02622         case FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES:
02623         case FATTR4_LEASE_TIME:
02624         case FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR:
02625         case FATTR4_ACL:
02626         case FATTR4_ACLSUPPORT:
02627         case FATTR4_ARCHIVE:
02628         case FATTR4_CANSETTIME:
02629         case FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE:
02630         case FATTR4_CASE_PRESERVING:
02631         case FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED:
02632         case FATTR4_FILEID:
02633         case FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL:
02634         case FATTR4_FILES_FREE:
02635         case FATTR4_FILES_TOTAL:
02636         case FATTR4_FS_LOCATIONS:
02637         case FATTR4_HIDDEN:
02638         case FATTR4_HOMOGENEOUS:
02639         case FATTR4_MAXFILESIZE:
02640         case FATTR4_MAXLINK:
02641         case FATTR4_MAXNAME:
02642         case FATTR4_MAXREAD:
02643         case FATTR4_MAXWRITE:
02644         case FATTR4_MIMETYPE:
02645         case FATTR4_MODE:
02646         case FATTR4_NO_TRUNC:
02647         case FATTR4_NUMLINKS:
02648         case FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD:
02649         case FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT:
02650         case FATTR4_QUOTA_USED:
02651         case FATTR4_RAWDEV:
02652         case FATTR4_SPACE_AVAIL:
02653         case FATTR4_SPACE_FREE:
02654         case FATTR4_SPACE_TOTAL:
02655         case FATTR4_SPACE_USED:
02656         case FATTR4_SYSTEM:
02657         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS:
02658         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET:
02659         case FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP:
02660         case FATTR4_TIME_CREATE:
02661         case FATTR4_TIME_DELTA:
02662         case FATTR4_TIME_METADATA:
02663         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY:
02664         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET:
02665         case FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID:
02666                  cmp += memcmp( (char *)(Fattr1->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02667                                (char *)(Fattr2->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02668                                fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
02669                 break ;
02670 
02671         default:
02672                 return 0 ; 
02673                 break ; 
02674        }
02675    }   
02676  if( cmp == 0 )
02677         return TRUE ;
02678  else
02679         return FALSE  ;
02680 }
02681 
02694 int nfs4_Fattr_To_FSAL_attr( fsal_attrib_list_t * pFSAL_attr,
02695                              fattr4             * Fattr )
02696 {
02697   u_int    LastOffset = 0  ;
02698   unsigned int i      = 0 ;
02699   char     __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_FattrToSattr" ;
02700   uint32_t attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
02701   uint32_t attrmasklen = 0 ;
02702   uint32_t attribute_to_set = 0 ; 
02703 
02704   int len;
02705   char buffer[MAXNAMLEN] ;
02706   utf8string utf8buffer ;
02707 
02708   fattr4_type            attr_type ;
02709   fattr4_fsid            attr_fsid ;
02710   fattr4_fileid          attr_fileid ;
02711   fattr4_time_modify_set attr_time_set ;
02712   fattr4_rdattr_error    rdattr_error ;
02713   nfstime4               attr_time ;
02714   fattr4_size            attr_size ;
02715   fattr4_change          attr_change ;
02716   fattr4_numlinks        attr_numlinks ;
02717   fattr4_rawdev          attr_rawdev ;
02718   fattr4_space_used      attr_space_used ;
02719   fattr4_time_access     attr_time_access ;
02720   fattr4_time_modify     attr_time_modify ;
02721   fattr4_time_metadata   attr_time_metadata ;
02722 
02723 
02724   
02725  
02726   if( pFSAL_attr == NULL || Fattr == NULL ) 
02727     return -1 ;
02728 
02729   /* Check attributes data */
02730   if( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val == NULL )
02731     return -1 ;
02732 
02733   /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
02734   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( &(Fattr->attrmask), &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
02735 
02736 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02737   printf( "   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list ====> attrmasklen = %d\n", attrmasklen ) ;
02738 #endif  
02739 
02740   /* Init */
02741   pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes = 0 ;
02742   
02743   for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen; i++ )
02744     {
02745       attribute_to_set = attrmasklist[i] ;
02746 
02747       if( attrmasklist[i] > FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID )
02748         {
02749           /* Erroneous value... skip */
02750           continue ;
02751         }
02752 
02753             
02754 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02755       printf( "=================> nfs4_Fattr_To_FSAL_attr: i=%u attr=%u\n", i, attrmasklist[i] ) ;
02756       printf( "Flag for Operation = %d|%d is ON,  name  = %s  reply_size = %d\n", attrmasklist[i], 
02757               fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].val, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
02758 #endif
02759        
02760       switch( attribute_to_set )
02761         {
02762         case FATTR4_TYPE: /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02763           memcpy( (char *)&attr_type,
02764                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02765                   sizeof( fattr4_type ) ) ;
02766 
02767  
02768           switch( ntohl( attr_type ) )
02769            {
02770             case NF4REG:
02771               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_FILE ;
02772               break ;
02773 
02774             case NF4DIR:
02775               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_DIR ;
02776               break ;
02777 
02778             case NF4BLK:
02779               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_BLK ;
02780               break ;
02781 
02782             case NF4CHR:
02783               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_CHR ;
02784               break ;
02785 
02786             case NF4LNK:
02787               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_LNK ;
02788               break ;
02789 
02790             case NF4SOCK:
02791               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_SOCK ;
02792               break ;
02793 
02794             case NF4FIFO:
02795               pFSAL_attr->type = FSAL_TYPE_FIFO ;
02796               break ;
02797 
02798             default: /* For wanting of a better solution */
02799               pFSAL_attr->type  =  0 ;
02800               break ;
02801             } /* switch( pattr->type ) */
02802 
02803           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_TYPE ;
02804           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02805 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
02806           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le type %d\n", pFSAL_attr->filesize ) ;
02807 #endif
02808           break ;
02809 
02810         case FATTR4_FILEID:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02811           /* The analog to the inode number. RFC3530 says "a number uniquely identifying the file within the filesystem"
02812            * I use hpss_GetObjId to extract this information from the Name Server's handle */
02813           memcpy( (char *)&attr_fileid,
02814                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02815                   sizeof( fattr4_fileid ) ) ;
02816           pFSAL_attr->fileid = nfs_ntohl64( attr_fileid ) ;
02817 
02818           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_FILEID ;
02819           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02820 
02821           break ;
02822 
02823         case FATTR4_FSID:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02824           memcpy( (char *)&attr_fsid,
02825                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02826                   sizeof( fattr4_fsid ) ) ;
02827           pFSAL_attr->fsid.major = nfs_ntohl64( attr_fsid.major ) ;
02828           pFSAL_attr->fsid.minor = nfs_ntohl64( attr_fsid.minor ) ;
02829 
02830           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_FSID ;
02831           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02832 
02833           break ;
02834 
02835 
02836          case FATTR4_NUMLINKS:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02837           memcpy( (char *)&attr_numlinks,
02838                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02839                   sizeof( fattr4_numlinks ) ) ;
02840           pFSAL_attr->numlinks = ntohl( attr_numlinks ) ;
02841 
02842           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_FILEID ;
02843           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02844 
02845           break ;
02846 
02847 
02848         case FATTR4_SIZE:
02849           memcpy( (char *)&attr_size, 
02850                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02851                   sizeof( fattr4_size ) ) ;
02852 
02853           /* Do not forget the XDR marshalling for the fattr4 stuff */
02854           pFSAL_attr->filesize = nfs_ntohl64( attr_size ) ;
02855 
02856           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ;
02857           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02858 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4          
02859           printf( "      SATTR: On voit la taille %d\n", pFSAL_attr->filesize ) ;
02860 #endif
02861           break ;
02862           
02863         case FATTR4_MODE:
02864           memcpy( (char *)&(pFSAL_attr->mode),
02865                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
02866                   sizeof( fattr4_mode ) ) ;
02867 
02868           /* Do not forget the XDR marshalling for the fattr4 stuff */
02869           pFSAL_attr->mode = ntohl(pFSAL_attr->mode);
02870 
02871           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_MODE ;
02872           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02873 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4                
02874           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le mode 0%o\n", pFSAL_attr->mode ) ;
02875 #endif
02876           break ;
02877           
02878         case  FATTR4_OWNER:
02879           memcpy( &len, (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
02880           len = ntohl( len ) ; /* xdr marshalling on fattr4 */
02881           LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
02882 
02883           memcpy( buffer, (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), len ) ;
02884           buffer[len] = '\0' ;
02885 
02886           /* Do not forget that xdr_opaque are aligned on 32bit long words */
02887           while ( ( len % 4 ) != 0 ) len += 1 ;
02888           
02889           LastOffset += len ;
02890 
02891           utf8buffer.utf8string_val = buffer ;
02892           utf8buffer.utf8string_len = strlen( buffer ) ;
02893 
02894           utf82uid( &utf8buffer, &(pFSAL_attr->owner) ) ;
02895           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_OWNER ;
02896 
02897 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4      
02898           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le owner %s len = %d\n", buffer, len ) ;
02899           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le owner %d\n", pFSAL_attr->owner ) ;
02900 #endif
02901           break ;
02902           
02903         case FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP:
02904           memcpy( &len, (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
02905           len = ntohl( len ) ;
02906           LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
02907 
02908           memcpy( buffer, (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), len ) ;
02909           buffer[len] = '\0' ;
02910 
02911            /* Do not forget that xdr_opaque are aligned on 32bit long words */
02912           while ( ( len % 4 ) != 0 ) len += 1 ;
02913 
02914           LastOffset += len ;
02915 
02916           utf8buffer.utf8string_val = buffer ;
02917           utf8buffer.utf8string_len = strlen( buffer ) ;
02918 
02919           utf82gid( &utf8buffer, &(pFSAL_attr->group) ) ;
02920           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ;
02921 
02922 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4   
02923           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le owner_group %s len = %d\n", buffer, len ) ;          
02924           printf( "      SATTR: On voit le owner_group %d\n", pFSAL_attr->group ) ;
02925 #endif
02926           break ;
02927 
02928         case FATTR4_CHANGE:
02929           memcpy( (char *)&attr_change,
02930                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02931                   sizeof( fattr4_change ) ) ;
02932           pFSAL_attr->chgtime.seconds  = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_change ) ;
02933           pFSAL_attr->chgtime.nseconds = 0 ;
02934 
02935           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_CHGTIME ;
02936           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02937 
02938           break ;
02939 
02940         case FATTR4_RAWDEV:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02941           memcpy( (char *)&attr_rawdev,
02942                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02943                   sizeof( fattr4_rawdev ) ) ;
02944           pFSAL_attr->rawdev.major  = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_rawdev.specdata1 ) ;
02945           pFSAL_attr->rawdev.minor  = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_rawdev.specdata2 ) ;
02946 
02947           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_RAWDEV ;
02948           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02949 
02950           break ;
02951 
02952         case FATTR4_SPACE_USED:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02953           memcpy( (char *)&attr_space_used,
02954                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02955                   sizeof( fattr4_space_used ) ) ;
02956           pFSAL_attr->spaceused  = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_space_used ) ;
02957 
02958           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
02959           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02960 
02961           break ;
02962 
02963 
02964         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02965           memcpy( (char *)&attr_time_access,
02966                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02967                   sizeof( fattr4_time_access ) ) ;
02968           pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds   = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_time_access.seconds ) ;
02969           pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds  = (uint32_t)ntohl( attr_time_access.nseconds ) ;
02970 
02971           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ;
02972           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02973 
02974           break ;
02975 
02976         case FATTR4_TIME_METADATA:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02977           memcpy( (char *)&attr_time_metadata,
02978                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02979                   sizeof( fattr4_time_metadata ) ) ;
02980           pFSAL_attr->ctime.seconds   = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_time_metadata.seconds ) ;
02981           pFSAL_attr->ctime.nseconds  = (uint32_t)ntohl( attr_time_metadata.nseconds ) ;
02982 
02983           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_CTIME ;
02984           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02985 
02986           break ;
02987 
02988         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY:  /* Used only by FSAL_PROXY to reverse convert */
02989           memcpy( (char *)&attr_time_modify,
02990                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
02991                   sizeof( fattr4_time_modify ) ) ;
02992           pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds   = (uint32_t)nfs_ntohl64( attr_time_modify.seconds ) ;
02993           pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds  = (uint32_t)ntohl( attr_time_modify.nseconds ) ;
02994 
02995           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ;
02996           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
02997 
02998           break ;
02999 
03000 
03001         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET:
03002           memcpy( (char *)&(attr_time_set.set_it),
03003                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
03004                   sizeof( time_how4 ) ) ;
03005 
03006           LastOffset += sizeof( time_how4 )  ;
03007 
03008           if( ntohl( attr_time_set.set_it ) == SET_TO_SERVER_TIME4 ) 
03009             {
03010                pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ; /* Use current server's time */
03011                pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = 0 ;
03012             }
03013           else
03014             {
03015                /* Read the remaining part of the data */
03016                memcpy( (char *)&(attr_time_set.settime4_u.time),
03017                        (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
03018                        sizeof( nfstime4 ) ) ;
03019                        
03020                LastOffset += sizeof( nfstime4 )  ;
03021 
03022                /* Take care of XDR when dealing with fattr4 */
03023                attr_time = attr_time_set.settime4_u.time ;
03024                attr_time.seconds  = nfs_ntohl64( attr_time.seconds ) ;
03025                attr_time.nseconds = ntohl( attr_time.nseconds ) ;
03026 
03027                pFSAL_attr->atime.seconds  = attr_time.seconds ;
03028                pFSAL_attr->atime.nseconds = attr_time.nseconds ;
03029             }
03030           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ;
03031 
03032           break ;
03033           
03034         case  FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET:
03035           memcpy( (char *)&(attr_time_set.set_it),
03036                   (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
03037                   sizeof( time_how4 ) ) ;
03038 
03039           LastOffset += sizeof( time_how4 )  ;
03040 
03041           if( ntohl( attr_time_set.set_it ) == SET_TO_SERVER_TIME4 )
03042             {
03043                pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ; /* Use current server's time */
03044                pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = 0 ;
03045             }
03046           else
03047             {
03048                /* Read the remaining part of the data */
03049                memcpy( (char *)&(attr_time_set.settime4_u.time),
03050                        (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), 
03051                        sizeof( nfstime4 ) ) ;
03052                        
03053                /* Take care of XDR when dealing with fattr4 */
03054                attr_time = attr_time_set.settime4_u.time ;
03055                attr_time.seconds  = nfs_ntohl64( attr_time.seconds ) ;
03056                attr_time.nseconds = ntohl( attr_time.nseconds ) ;
03057 
03058                LastOffset += sizeof( nfstime4 )  ;
03059 
03060                pFSAL_attr->mtime.seconds  = attr_time.seconds ;
03061                pFSAL_attr->mtime.nseconds = attr_time.nseconds ;
03062             }
03063 
03064           pFSAL_attr->asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ;
03065 
03066           break ;
03067           
03068         case FATTR4_FILEHANDLE:
03069            memcpy( &len, (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset), sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
03070            len = ntohl( len ) ;
03071            LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
03072            LastOffset += len ;
03073 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4   
03074            printf( "     SATTR: On a demande le filehandle len =%u\n", len ) ;
03075 #endif
03076            break ;
03077           
03078         case FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR: 
03079            memcpy( (char *)&rdattr_error,
03080                    (char *)(Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val + LastOffset),
03081                    sizeof( fattr4_rdattr_error ) ) ;
03082            rdattr_error = ntohl( rdattr_error ) ;
03083            LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
03084 
03085            break ;
03086 
03087         default:
03088 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4   
03089           printf( "      SATTR: Attribut no supporte %d name=%s\n", attribute_to_set, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name ) ;
03090 #endif
03091           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
03092           /* return 0 ; */ /* Should not stop processing */
03093           break ;
03094         } /* switch */
03095     } /* for */
03096 
03097   return 1 ;
03098 } /* nfs4_Fattr_To_FSAL_attr */
03099

03114 nfsstat4 nfs4_Errno( cache_inode_status_t error ) 
03115 {
03116   nfsstat4 nfserror ;
03117   
03118  switch( error )
03119     {
03120     case CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS:
03121       nfserror = NFS4_OK ;
03122       break ;
03123       
03124     case CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR:
03125     case CACHE_INODE_POOL_MUTEX_INIT_ERROR:
03126     case CACHE_INODE_GET_NEW_LRU_ENTRY:
03127     case CACHE_INODE_INIT_ENTRY_FAILED:
03128     case CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS:
03129     case CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EMPTY:
03130       nfserror = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
03131       break ;
03132 
03133     case CACHE_INODE_UNAPPROPRIATED_KEY:
03134       nfserror = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
03135       break ;
03136       
03137     case CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE:
03138       nfserror = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
03139       break ;
03140 
03141     case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR:
03142     case CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT:
03143       nfserror = NFS4ERR_PERM ;
03144       break ;
03145       
03146     case  CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY:
03147       nfserror = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR  ;
03148       break ;
03149 
03150     case CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS:
03151       nfserror = NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
03152       break ;
03153       
03154       
03155     case CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY:
03156       nfserror = NFS4ERR_NOTEMPTY ;
03157       break ;
03158       
03159     case CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND:
03160       nfserror = NFS4ERR_NOENT ;
03161       break ;
03162       
03163     case CACHE_INODE_INSERT_ERROR:
03164     case  CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR:
03165     case CACHE_INODE_HASH_SET_ERROR :
03166       nfserror = NFS4ERR_IO ;
03167       break ;
03168       
03169     case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EACCESS:
03170       nfserror = NFS4ERR_ACCESS ;
03171       break ;
03172 
03173     case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EPERM:
03174       nfserror = NFS4ERR_PERM ;
03175       break ;
03176 
03177     case CACHE_INODE_NO_SPACE_LEFT:
03178       nfserror = NFS4ERR_NOSPC ;
03179       break ;
03180       
03181     case CACHE_INODE_IS_A_DIRECTORY:
03182       nfserror = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ;
03183       break ;
03184 
03185     case CACHE_INODE_READ_ONLY_FS:
03186       nfserror = NFS4ERR_ROFS ;
03187       break ;
03188 
03189     case CACHE_INODE_IO_ERROR:
03190       nfserror = NFS4ERR_IO ;
03191       break ;
03192 
03193     case CACHE_INODE_DEAD_ENTRY:
03194     case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE:
03195       nfserror = NFS4ERR_STALE ;
03196       break ;
03197 
03198     case CACHE_INODE_STATE_CONFLICT:
03199       nfserror = NFS4ERR_PERM ;
03200       break ;
03201 
03202     case CACHE_INODE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED:
03203       nfserror = NFS4ERR_DQUOT ;
03204       break ;
03205       
03206     case CACHE_INODE_NOT_SUPPORTED:
03207       nfserror = NFS4ERR_NOTSUPP ;
03208       break ;
03209 
03210     case CACHE_INODE_FSAL_DELAY:
03211       nfserror = NFS4ERR_DELAY ;
03212       break ;
03213 
03214     default: /* Should not occur */
03215       nfserror = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
03216       break ;
03217     }
03218 
03219   return nfserror ;
03220 } /* nfs4_Errno */

03330       break ;      
03331

03333       DisplayLog( "Line %u should never be reached in nfs3_Errno for cache_status=%u", __LINE__ , error ) ;
03334       nfserror = NFS3ERR_INVAL ;
03335       break ;

03456 int nfs4_AllocateFH( nfs_fh4 * fh )
03457 {
03458   char __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[]= "AllocateFH4" ;
03459 
03460   if( fh == NULL )
03461     return NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT;
03462 
03463 
03464 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
03465   /* For debugging memory leaks */
03466   BuddySetDebugLabel( "nfs4_AllocateFH" ) ; 
03467 #endif
03468  
03469   /* Allocating the filehandle in memory */
03470   fh->nfs_fh4_len = sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ;  
03471   if( ( fh->nfs_fh4_val = (char*)Mem_Alloc( fh->nfs_fh4_len  )) == NULL )
03472     {
03473       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
03474       return NFS4ERR_RESOURCE ;
03475     }
03476 
03477 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
03478   /* For debugging memory leaks */
03479   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
03480 #endif
03481  
03482   memset((char *)fh->nfs_fh4_val, 0, fh->nfs_fh4_len ) ;
03483 
03484   return NFS4_OK ;
03485 } /* nfs4_AllocateFH */
03486 
03498 int nfs4_MakeCred( compound_data_t * data )
03499 {
03500   exportlist_client_entry_t    related_client ;
03501   nfs_worker_data_t          * pworker = NULL ;
03502 
03503   pworker = (nfs_worker_data_t *)data->pclient->pworker ;
03504 
03505   if( nfs_export_check_access( &pworker->hostaddr,
03506                                data->reqp,
03507                                data->pexport,
03508                                nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
03509                                nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
03510                                pworker->ht_ip_stats,
03511                                pworker->ip_stats_pool,
03512                                &related_client ) == FALSE )
03513         return NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
03514 
03515 
03516   if( nfs_build_fsal_context( data->reqp, &related_client,  data->pexport, data->pcontext ) == FALSE )
03517     return NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
03518 
03519   return NFS4_OK ;
03520 } /* nfs4_MakeCred */
